alert.note: Alert for Northern Oregon Cascades; Upper Hood River Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 2:35PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Clackamas, southern Hood River and extreme eastern Multnomah Counties through 315 PM PDT... At 233 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Timothy Lake, or 8 miles south of Government Camp, moving to the north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, dangerous lightning, and brief heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain could cause local ponding of water. Locations impacted include... Government Camp, Mount Hood, Parkdale, Lolo Pass, Bennett Pass, Lost Lake and White River Snow Park. This includes the following highways in Oregon... U.S. Highway 26 east of Portland between mile markers 50 and 62. State Highway 35 between mile markers 58 and 85. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Northern Oregon Cascades; Upper Hood River Valley
